activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charlie B. Hillman

defendant.name: Hillman, Charlie B.
defendant.address: 701 W. Seminary St. #207E, Richland Center, WI 53581

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM Defendant Charlie B. Hillman in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Charlie B. Hillman.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt informs the court that a waiver of the preliminary hearing  has been filed. Court goes over the waiver of preliminary form. Court binds over for trial.

Attorney Harper asks for a January date for the arraignment. Attorney Bartelt agrees. Attorney Harper states that at that time the court may move to dismiss at that time.
Arraignment scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:23 PM Defendant Charlie B. Hillman in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by video for Charlie B. Hillman.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bartelt has review the complaint and waives the formal reading. Attorney Bartelt waives the time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

12:30 PM Defendant Charlie B. Hillman in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. CH has received the complaint. CH doesn't have an attorney. Max penalties stated. CH has been provided the phone number for the public defenders office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:16 PM Defendant Charlie Hillman appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Rhodes appears for the public defender office of Lancaster. Court finds probable cause. Attorney Forehand asks for a $1,000 signature bond with the no drink provisions. No objection from Attorney Rhodes.

Court orders $1,000 signature bond 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 
Defendant shall take any prescribed prescription as prescribed.

Initial set for 08/04/22 at 11 AM
